DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine benefit fit low astigmats soft toric contact lenses versus spherical contact lenses regard visual comfort , eyestrain , fit efficiency , visual performance .
DOC.criteria: 1 . The subject must read , understand , sign statement inform consent receive fully execute copy Informed Consent Form . 2 . The subject must appear able willing adhere instruction set forth protocol . 3 . The subject must 18 year 45 year age ( inclusive ) . 4 . The subject must bestcorrected Snellen visual acuity 20/30 good eye . 5 . If subject ever wear contact lens , subject must current wearer soft spherical contact lenses least 5 days/week least 8 hours/day month prior enrollment . 6 . Subjective refraction must result vertexcorrected astigmatic contact lens prescription require least 0.75 DC 1.75 DC cylindrical contact lens correction eye . 7 . Subjective refraction must result vertexcorrected spherical contact lens prescription +0.25D +4.00D between0.50D 9.00D eye . 8 . The subject must need presbyopic correction ( i.e. , must use add spectacle wear multifocal monofocal contact lens ) . 9 . The subject must normal eye evidence abnormality disease opinion investigator would contraindicate contact lens wear . 10 . The subject must access internet throughout day ( either desktop and/or smartphone ) willing answer webbased survey within 1 hour receive text message base notification throughout day 8 day , throughout study duration . 1 . Selfreported current pregnancy lactation plan become pregnant study period ( subject report become pregnant study discontinue ) 2 . Any previous ocular intraocular surgery ( e.g . radial keratotomy , PRK , LASIK , etc . ) 3 . Any clinically meaningful slit lamp finding contraindicate contact lens wear ( e.g . great equal grade 3 finding edema , corneal neovascularization , corneal staining , conjunctival injection , blepharitis/meibomian gland dysfunction ) FDA classification scale ocular abnormality opinion investigator may contraindicate contact lens wear . 4 . Any ocular infection 5 . Current use topical ophthalmic medication artificial tears/rewetting drop . 6 . History binocular vision abnormality strabismus . 7 . Any infectious disease ( e.g . hepatitis , tuberculosis ) contagious immunosuppressive disease ( e.g . HIV ) selfreport . 8 . Other active ocular disease opinion investigator would contraindicate contact lens wear . 9 . Employee investigational clinic ( e.g . investigator , coordinator , technician ) 10 . Subject wearable pair spectacle .
